channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large overhanging tree on Lloyd Villas dropping branches onto road and parked cars - pruning required, 3rd September
item.description:
This large roadside tree on Lloyd Villas has not been maintained for years and has become hazardous. As shown in the attached photo, the branches now overhang much of the carriageway and pavement. Several branches have already broken off and fallen, damaging parked vehicles below. The canopy is excessively wide and heavy, increasing the risk of further branch falls, especially during wet or windy weather. It also obstructs light and visibility along the street, making conditions less safe for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians. The situation presents a clear health and safety risk as well as the likelihood of further property damage. Prompt pruning or other maintenance is required to prevent accidents and potential liability claims against the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lloyd Villas, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on Lloyd Villas Road damaging vehicles, 3rd September
item.description:
This pothole has been present for over three years and has steadily worsened. It is now approximately half a metre wide and several inches deep, sitting directly in line with car wheels as they pass. Vehicles travelling along Lloyd Villas have suffered damage to tyres and suspensions. After rain it fills with water, making it almost invisible and more dangerous to drivers and cyclists alike. The size and depth of the hole risk undermining the kerb and road edge. It poses a safety hazard not just to cars but also to cyclists who may be forced into traffic to avoid it, and to pedestrians nearby if vehicles swerve suddenly. Given the extended period this has been left unrepaired, the growing risk of accidents, and the ongoing damage it is causing, urgent repair is required. If not addressed promptly, this defect could expose the council to liability for vehicle damage and injury claims.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lloyd Villas, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars speeding in the evening, 3rd September
item.description:
On several occasions, cars are speeding in the stretch of Church street in front of the park, especially in the evenings. Sometimes they leave very small space for cyclist and it feels very dangerous. Can something be done?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
